alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches; Inland Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 6:13PM EST until December 18 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Inland Sussex and Delaware Beaches. * WHEN...Until 11 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is for back bays in Sussex County, mainly limtited now to Little Assawoman Bay. Due to a combination of higher than normal tidal waters lingering in the bay and runoff from excessive rainfall Sunday night. High tide has otherwise passed, and water levels will gradually recede this evening. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Delaware Bay at Lewes MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 7.0 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 19/01 AM 4.0 -0.7 0.2 None 19/02 PM 3.5 -1.2 -0.8 None 20/02 AM 4.0 -0.7 0.1 None 20/03 PM 4.4 -0.2 0.4 None 21/04 AM 4.8 0.2 0.6 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
